text: Hi All when i try to run peer cmd am getting peer not found error could some one please provide a solution i pulled v0.6 fabric only

No command 'peer' found, did you mean:
 Command 'beer' from package 'gerstensaft' (universe)
 Command 'pee' from package 'moreutils' (universe)
 Command 'pear' from package 'php-pear' (main)
 Command 'peet' from package 'pipexec' (universe)
peer: command not found

<@U1SHFS1Q9> .. i succeeded in " go build " .. for that i had to remove the docker images .. when i re-pulled the peer and membersrvc again, the "go build" for chaincode_example02 issue was not there and it created  "chaincode_example02" executable file. Now I am facing the same issue as <@U36HLH8SC> (in the above comment).. when i googled about it everyone is talking about the "$GOPATH/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/build/bin/" ,.. but there is no build folder inside fabric folder.. any help on that?
Hi. Please take a look at my article here about Hyperledger vs Corda (pt.1) - <https://medium.com/chain-cloud-company-blog/hyperledger-vs-corda-pt-1-3723c4fa5028>

attachments.title: Hyperledger vs Corda Pt.1 – Chain.Cloud company blog
attachments.text: This is a first article in our “Hyperledger vs Corda” series. In this one, we are going to talk only about the similarities of these two…
attachments.fallback: Medium: Hyperledger vs Corda Pt.1 – Chain.Cloud company blog

text:
When i am trying to run "make peer" command inside fabric folder it's giving an error "core/committer/txvalidator/validator.go:20:2: cannot find package "context" in any of:
	/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric/vendor/context (vendor tree)
	/opt/go/src/context (from $GOROOT)
	/opt/gopath/src/context (from $GOPATH)
make: *** [build/bin/peer] Error 1
"

v1.0 compiled peer binary doesn't have network login command, how should fabric peer authentication be performed/protocoled? 
Can REST approach can still be used to launch the chaincode as shown in documentation for chaincode example02?
